form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Paul introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide for full expensing of tangible property.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Full Expensing Act of 2015.

section.header: Permanent expansion of election to expense certain depreciable assets

subsection.header: Expansion of types of property subject to election
subsection.text: Paragraph (1) of section 179(d) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: For purposes of this section, the term section 179 property means property—

clause.text: computer software (as defined in section 197(e)(3)(B)) which is described in section 197(e)(3)(A)(i),
for use in a trade or business, or
for the production of income, and

subparagraph.text: which was originally placed in service after the date of the enactment of the Full Expensing Act of 2015.

subsection.text: Section 179 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking subsection (b).
Section 179 of such Code is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (c)(2), by striking and before 2015, and

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to property placed in service after the date of the enactment of this Act.
